runs.comm: ooh, straight away Nannes has beaten the bat. On a length, just outside off and Lumb flashed leaden-footed at it.
edged! High and wide of where a third or fourth slip would have been, but a definite edge down to third man, who makes a good, tumbling stop
beaten again, this is a great opening over from Nannes! Angling across Kieswetter from wide of the crease and beating his defensive prod with movement away from the bat
Kieswetter is firmly behind the ball this time, getting back and across to defend back down the pitch with the straightest of bats
Nannes is really steaming in here, good pace tucks Kieswetter up as he shapes to nudge to leg but is forced into a hurried defensive stroke at the very last moment

Kieswetter didn't know much about that one! It was short, delivered from wide of the crease and the batsman was back into the pull shot. The ball reared up though, taking the edge and looping up and over the off side field
back of a length to start, half-guided off the outer half of the bat down to third man. Pacy start
dug in, but Kieswetter is back and across in a flash to tuck him firmly to square leg, but straight to the fielder

timing from Kieswetter! He was expecting the short ball and was very deep in the crease. The ball was hurled down on a length and he aimed a defensive push through the off side, finding the gap nicely and timing it too
sharp single, drop and run from England's openers

Gone! Tait strikes in his first over! It was pitched up, taking Lumb somewhat by surprise. He whipped meatily to leg, getting a good connection to the shot, but hit it uppishly and straight to a wide-ish mid on, who clung on gratefully!
a touch of swing from Tait there as he flung the ball down on a length, but KP got firmly behind it and immediately found the middle of the bat as he pushed the ball firmly to mid off
sharp bouncer from Nannes! Banged in half way down, and Kieswetter ducked out of the way just in the nick of time
and again! This one was slightly shorter, giving Kieswetter a millisecond longer to react and sway out of the way, but a sharp bouncer all the same

Kieswetter is looking a little rattled out there now, this was short of a length again and he backed away a touch but didn't really move his feet apart from that, swishing airily outside off as the ball whizzed past
yep, much happier with the ball pitched up is Kieswetter. This one was full and on the legs and he flicked it up and over wide mid on for a counter-punching boundary

well, the break hasn't hurt Kieswetter at all! Pitched up again from Nannes, and wide of off stump too and Kieswetter just leaned forward into a sumptuous cover drive. Great shot, and England are up and running again
Nannes reverts to back of a length. Kieswetter looks to work it down to third man, but can't get the ball away
dug in halfway down by Tait, but Pietersen isn't in the least bit flustered. He just stood up tall and thumped it away off the back foot between midwicket and mid on
slower cutter from Tait this time, pitched up and on the legs and Pietersen flicks him away in the air infront of square. The fielder chases it down before the rope however
attempted yorker from Tait, but it turned into a full toss. Still, that was mighty fast and Kieswetter couldn't get anything but a boot on it. Slipping way down leg though, no appeal

Tait unleashes a brutal bumper as Kieswetter backs away and tries to flay through the off side. The ball reared up and over the bat though, and the close fielders are just having a word in his ear now
what a sensational shot! Kieswetter stayed deep in the crease as Tait went full and absolutely laced a lofted drove over the offside field. That screamed to the boundary, top shot
pitched up again and on the leg, Kieswetter nudges to leg but square cuts it off
a length ball pitching middle and off is punched into the off side and they scamper a quick run
back of a length stuff, hitting the deck hard, and Kieswetter is back and across in defence
he aimed for the cutter there, but it came out slightly wrong, wide of off, and Kieswetter just opened the face on it to collect one to third man
and the change of angle has done him. That started wide of leg and went further, beating a diving Brad Haddin and away to the boundary
finds his radar this time, hurling down a length ball on middle and leg, which Pietersen nudges gently to mid on
thrashed! Looked like a slower cutter again and Pietersen stood up tall to slap the ball through the covers. Pietersen has hit his stride early and looks in ominous touch here
pushed softly to mid off, and they sprint through for one. KP keeps strike
on a length and Pietersen swivelled to muscle it across the line and out to the deep midwicket fielder
off the outer edge of the blade and down to third man
Kieswetter follows suit, opening the face on the bat to run the ball down to third man
sharp yorker from Nannes! That was really quick and right on the mark, and Pietersen only just managed to get his bat down on time
banged in short, Pietersen pulls it away, taking the bottom hand off the bat as he does so. No power in the shot, but they collect one as the ball rolls into the gap
rip-snorter of a bouncer to finish the over, rising past Kieswetter's grille as he buckles his knees to get out of the way

Johnson steams in and digs one in back of a length, Pietersen shapes to tuck the ball to leg but is surprised by the pace and bounce and the ball takes the leading edge, ending up behind square on the off side
pushed down the ground, where mid off sprints back to cut the ball off and save at least two runs
zoning in on Pietersen's thigh pad and tucking him up quite nicely. No run
and again, Johnson beats bat and strikes thigh pad as Pietersen can't get it away
fuller this time, and punched down the ground for two

thumped. Johnson went full and wide and Pietersen certainly didn't miss out on the chance, absolutely hammering a drive past the cover fielders and away to the boundary. The fielders were mere spectators there, barely moved as the ball raced away
too straight to start, and Kieswetter gets across his stumps to work the ball behind square on the leg side
Pietersen's just having a little look before he goes, stretching forward in watchful defence first up
tossed up again and wide of off this time, Pietersen chops the ball out to the cover sweeper
Kieswetter uses his feet, charging aggressively down the track but driving straight to the cover fielder
stays deep in the crease this time, as Smith pitches this one just a touch short and is pushed away off the back foot
great end to the over, for England! Flighted on off stump and Pietersen came out to drive, nailing the shot between the fielders on the off side to find the boundary.
under-edged down to third man to start, Nannes sprints round to cut it off
Watto goes full again, perhaps looking for a hint of swing, and is driven firmly but straight to mid off
width offered by Watson this time, and Kieswetter flashes him away behind square on the off side. A diving Mike Hussey saves two runs on the boundary though, great fielding effort
Kieswetter comes down the track this time - with Haddin standing up - and just about yorks himself in the process

well, after the great effort from Mike, his brother David has let the side down a little with this attempts. The ball was full and hammered just wide of mid off. Hussey should have cut it off easily, but fell right over the ball without stopping it
ooh, and Watto is disconsolate now as he dishes up a short, wide long hop and is crunched away in the air behind point. No stopping that one!
imperious stuff from Pietersen, who walked down at Johnson and hammered him straight back down the ground. The fielder on the ropes is fairly straight though, so cut off
Kieswetter backs away and flaps, the ball comes off the inside edge and just wide of mid on, allowing them to steal a run
pushed down to long off, and they amble through for a single
well, Kieswetter heaves mightily to leg as Johnson comes round the wicket, but he's just tried to hit it too hard and ended up toeing it to nowhere
pitched wide of off and angling wider, driven out to the cover sweeper
oh my, how did that miss the stumps? Kieswetter back away to fly-swat the ball away but Johnson fired in a searing yorker that dipped under the bat and just nipped past the off stump

was that a drop? If it was, it was a very hard chance. Pietersen swung a half volley to the leg side, but hit the ball in the air. Johnson was at a straight midwickets and reached down but couldn't quite get a hand underneath it
Watto sends down the bouncer but that's dug in way too short
goes fuller again, and Pietersen nudges to leg to collect one

big hit! How has he hit that? The ball was full and Kieswetter swung hard through the line. It looked like a straight top edge, but somehow the ball just kept on going, eventually plummeting down in the crowd beyond cow corner

alarming running from England, as the ball was mis-timed to the leg side and they scampered a mad two. Better fielding could have seen Kieswetter run out there, but the throw from the outfield went to the wrong end

Watto is being systematically targeted here, they're going hard at everything and this time he's been flashed up and over third man - who was in - for yet another boundary. England are coasting now, and Kieswetter is nearing what could be a world cup-winning 50!
swinging full toss dished up this time, but Kieswetter can't get anything on it
full and on the toes to start, and flicked away to deep square leg
Kieswetter stays very deep in the crease and leg side of the ball, working a full delivery away on the leg side. They think about pushing for two, briefly
have that! Tait has steamed in and Pietersen has lifted him straight back over his head, nonchalantly. Four runs, and a more imposing shot you will not see
is Tait flustered here? He aims for the yorker but it slips out way down leg

what can you do when a batsman is hitting them like this? The ball was pitched up again, full and very fast, and Pietersen swung cleanly, opening the face just a touch, to send the ball sailing way, way over long off.
predictably, he slips short this time but Pietersen is waiting for it, and pulls out to deep square leg
and that'll be Kieswetter's fifty! Short and wide, slapped out to cover point to reach a fluent fifty
they just can't plug the gaps! Wherever a fielder is moved from, that's where the ball is hit. Third man is up, and Kieswetter backs away to slash Nannes up and over him
one-handed! He's hit that one-handed! Kieswetter backed away and Nannes followed him this time, but was swung cleanly into the crowd behind square on the leg side. What a shot.
slapped through the covers this time, and the sweeper runs in to field
pushed into space on the off side, and they pick up another easy single with the field spread. No pressure on these two now, it'll be a miracle if Australia can claw their way back

close! Kieswetter shuffled right across to the off side this time, swiping to leg, and Nannes fired in a very full fast ball. Huge appeal for lbw, but not given. Replays suggest that was hitting middle halfway up, so a very lucky break for Kieswetter there
punched down the ground by Pietersen, and the target is now 30 from 42. Should be easy. Should.

Pietersen goes! Smith strikes! The batsman was on the charge straight away, looking to hit the ball into orbit down the ground. He hit too far across the line though, with the ball turning from leg to off, getting underneath it. Long off circled beneath the chance, setting himself and holding on to a swirling chance
too short, too wide, and Kieswetter stays back to slap that out to cover
drifting into his pads there, and Colly is unapologetically nurdling already to pick up one just wide of midwicket
Kieswetter stretches out to defend a flighted delivery back down the pitch
punched off the back foot, but the diving cover fielder cuts if off to negate the run
slipping too far down leg, despite the turn on offer, and he's clipped square for one

what on earth happened there? Kieswetter gave himself acres of space as he backed away to leg, with Johnson coming round the wicket, and the bowler simply speared one in full and straight. Kieswetter must've been fooled by the angle, because he didn't even try to hit that. Just left alone, and the ball made a mess of the stumps.
Johnson goes full from over the wicket, and Morgan drives watchfully to mid off
ooh, nerves! Hurled down on a length, Morgan was neither forward nor back and he had a little nervous fiddle outside off stump. Lucky not to get anything on that
beaten again outside off stump! Slightly fuller and Morgan flashed nervously outside off again, hitting only fresh air
very full and tapped gently to mid off
well, that spoils what was a top-class over. Johnson fires one down the leg side, and Umpire Doctrove gets to stretch his arms
on the pads and slapped away, one-handed, on the leg side for one
wrong 'un! Not picked by Morgan, who had come down the track to try and flick to leg. He was lucky that he got his body behind that
six runs! A pressure-relieving shot, to be sure. Morgan went to the slog sweep and executed the shot to perfection.
two runs this time, as Morgan works the ball into a big space between long on and midwicket
two more! Great running as a quicker, flatter ball is punched out on the leg side
Morgan dances down the track but turns the ball into a yorker in the process, no run
another wrong 'un, but he's picked it this time, chopping the ball behind square to keep strike

big shot from Morgan! He heaved to leg, but top-edged. The fielder couldn't get around in time though, and despite a diving effort couldn't get close to taking the catch. They run two amidst the drama
chopped down just fine of the keeper, Colly calls him through for a quick single
six runs! What a shot! Collingwood is confidently into a front-foot pull, sending the ball sailing way over the fielder at square leg. He took him on, and beat him there
a bouncer is the reply from a disgruntled Watto, and Collingwood can't get it away
they're level! Collingwood aims a full-blooded swing to the leg side, somewhat inside-edging it and the ball scoots away to the fine leg boundary
it's all over! Smashed away past midwicket, and England are the winners of the ICC World Twenty20 2010!!
